filesystem

Class File<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • filesystem.FSElement
      • filesystem.File<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Readable, Writable<T>

    public class File<T>
extends FSElement
implements Writable<T>, Readable
    This class represents a file object in the JShell It's contents can be read, and written.
    Author:
    anton

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      File(java.lang.String name, Directory parent)
      Create a new file with the given name, and empty contents.
      File(java.lang.String name, T contents, Directory parent)
      Create a new file given a name and the contents of the file.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Empties the contents of the file.
      FSElement copy()
      Clones the current file.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Gets if the file is empty.
      java.lang.String read()
      Allows for reading of the data as a string from the file.
      void write(T contents)
      Writes the contents to the file.
      void writeln(T contents)
      Writes a line to the contents to the file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • File

        public File(java.lang.String name,
            T contents,
            Directory parent)
        Create a new file given a name and the contents of the file.
        Parameters:
        name - The name by which the file is to be referred, may or may not contain an extension.
        contents - The text data stored inside the file.
        parent - The parent directory of this file.

      • File

        public File(java.lang.String name,
            Directory parent)
        Create a new file with the given name, and empty contents.
        Parameters:
        name - The name by which the file is to be referred, may or may not contain an extension.
        parent - The parent directory of this file.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(T contents)
        Writes the contents to the file. Does not change the old contents.
        Specified by:
        write in interface Writable<T>
        Parameters:
        contents - The data to be added to the file.

      • writeln

        public void writeln(T contents)
        Writes a line to the contents to the file. Does not change the old contents.
        Specified by:
        writeln in interface Writable<T>
        Parameters:
        contents - The data to be added to the file.

      • read

        public java.lang.String read()
        Allows for reading of the data as a string from the file.
        Specified by:
        read in interface Readable
        Returns:
        The full contents of the file. Returns an empty string if the file is empty.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Empties the contents of the file.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Gets if the file is empty.
        Returns:
        Return true iff the file is empty.

      • copy

        public FSElement copy()
        Clones the current file. Warning: when cloning, the new instance is unlinked (ie the parent directory has no record of it as its child).
        Overrides:
        copy in class FSElement
        Returns:
        Returns the cloned instance.
